meanings.definition: One who enters a place without permission.
meanings.sent1: The intruder sneaked into the house through the window.
meanings.sent2: The security guard caught the intruder trying to break into the building.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat acted like an intruder when it entered the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: The intruder of privacy, the nosy neighbor, always peeked through the fence.
meanings.sent5: The intruder, with a mask and flashlight, was a scary sight in the dark.

meanings.definition: A person who intrudes or interferes in a situation.
meanings.sent1: The noisy intruder disrupted the meeting with their constant interruptions.
meanings.sent2: She felt like an intruder in their private conversation, so she excused herself.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was an intruder in the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His loud laughter was an intruder in the solemn atmosphere of the church.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected guest was an intruder in their carefully planned surprise party.

meanings.definition: An unauthorized person who gains access to a computer system.
meanings.sent1: The hacker was identified as the intruder who breached the company's database.
meanings.sent2: The IT team worked tirelessly to prevent any intruder from hacking into the system.
meanings.sent3: The virus acted like an intruder, causing chaos in the computer network.
meanings.sent4: The intrusive pop-up ads were like digital intruders on the website.
meanings.sent5: The cybersecurity software detected the intruder attempting to access sensitive information.
